title: Flow Theory-Based VR Language Learning Design: Intensive Short-Term Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with VR technology and intermediate or higher language proficiency
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment centered on language practice, accessing VR content via mobile devices in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain flow state induction mechanisms (task-skill balance, immediate feedback, interactivity) in VR environments with over 80% accuracy.
Learners report a flow state experience averaging 4.0 or higher (on a 5-point Flow State Scale) during VR-based language tasks.
Learners complete and submit a language project (3-minute presentation video) incorporating peer feedback after role-playing in VR simulations.

resources: Flow-Based Language Learning VR Content Package

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
